article.headline: Virginia Military 93, Richmond 84
article.story: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) -- Chavis and Travis Holmes combined for 11 points during a 14-3 VMI run midway through the second half that propelled the Keydets to a 93-84 win over Richmond Wednesday. With the game tied at 64 with 9:45 remaining, Chavis Holmes hit a 3-pointer, igniting the run, which ended with another 3-pointer from him with 8:05 remaining and the Keydets up 78-67. Richmond could get no closer than seven the rest of the way. The Spiders (4-5) led 42-40 at halftime, helped by a 14-0 run late in the half. Brian Morris scored six and David Gonzalvez four during the run, which gave the Spiders a 38-36 lead with 46 seconds remaining. VMI's hectic pace forced 26 Richmond turnovers, which the Keydets (6-8) converted into 33 points. Reggie Williams led the Keydets with 28 points, hitting 10 of 15 field goals. Travis Holmes added 19, and Chavis Holmes 18. Matt Murrer had 16 points. The Keydets hit their first 17 free throws and finished 23 of 26 for the game. Kevin Hovde came off the bench for Richmond, hitting 9 of 14 field goals for 24 points. Gonzalvez added 15 and Dan Geriot had 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
